page.title: 15Biography Crosthwaite 'area'
page.content: {Nurse Bownass:}a Community Nursing Sister has many {Hobbies:- {A collection of 800 dolls:}The oldest two are split-head wax dolls, dating from 1840. The smallest is 1cm. high, carved from wood, with moveable arms and legs,and it fits into a wooden egg <c.1900>. The largest is 28"high, with a German porcelain head <c.1910>. Her collection, over 30 years,contains modern and National costume dolls.Many have needed to be cleaned,repaired, given new hair & clothes,all of which Nurse does herself,using self-taught skills <in miniature>, of embroidery, hand-sewing, bead-work, basketry, hat- making, crochet,pewter & leather work. {Making Doll's Houses:}in miniature. {Kendal Hospital Radio:}shared with her husband,arranges patient's Quiz Shows. {Making a Video record:}of the 'History of the Crosthwaite 'area'
